conbody.p: Associations are class properties that represent unidirectional relationships between two classes.
Associations can be either by value or by reference, which respectively correspond to the object-oriented concepts of composition (intrinsic property) and aggregation (extrinsic property).

Instances of class associated by value have the same life cycle as their containing instance; they do not exist outside of the scope of this container and cannot be referenced directly. A typical example is a Portfolio class that is associated by value to a Position class that represents the held positions.

Instances of class associated by reference have their own life cycle and live outside of the scope of the referencing class instance. A typical example is a Portfolio class that is associated by reference to the Client that owns the portfolio.
The associated class can belong to another domain model file.
